thread.title: IPL auction: About 350 players to go under hammer today
thread.title_full: IPL auction: About 350 players to go under hammer today

author: Internet Desk
title: IPL auction: About 350 players to go under hammer today
text:
February 20, 2017 08:21   08:21 IST more-in This is the last auction of the 10-year cycle after which all players are set to go back into the auction pool. 
The auction for the 10th season of Indian Premier League will begin on Monday at 9 a.m. , in Bengaluru. 
There will be a strong focus on buying uncapped Indian players with eight franchises gearing up to pick a maximum of 76 out of the 350 plus, who will go under the hammer. Read more 
This is the last auction of the 10-year cycle after which all players are set to go back into the auction pool. While the maximum squad strength can be 27, most franchises like to keep squad base between 22 and 24. 
Live Updates 
8.05 a.m.: On Sunday, the captaincy baton of Rising Pune Supergiants, one of the two Indian Premier League newbies, has been passed on from Mahendra Singh Dhoni, the most successful India captain across formats, to Steven Smith, Australia’s Test skipper. Read more 
8.00 a.m.: About a week before, the BCCI has incorporated strict guidelines in their 19-page ‘Request For Proposals’ (RFP) from interested companies that will stage 8 opening ceremonies during the first match of all the eight franchises including the closing ceremony in Hyderabad.
